messageBody:
ernsthlg wrote:
> Hello,
>
> Is a tool out there, which generates suites for each package? Each
> suite should contain all tests of its package and all suites of the
> direct subpackages. Furthermore it should be able to update the
> relevant suites, if anywhere a new test was added.
>
> I seek for such a tool, because i am going to intigrate TestCases one
> by one to an existing large project. For now only a few tests exist,
> but they are spread over all the packages. To be able to execute these
> tests i want a root-suite which contains all existing tests. But i
> donÂ´t want to write suites for each package by hand.

When you say "write suites", what do you mean? What specifically do you
expect such a tool to do? It sounds like you want something to collect a
number of test case classes together to execute as a single suite.

Ant (http://ant.apache.org) already helps collect all the TestCase
classes from a certain part of the file system (matching by filename
patterns) and execute them as a large test suite. Look at its
<batchtest> task.

Also, look at JUnit-addons' DirectorySuiteBuilder, which you can start
using more quickly than Ant, but which /only/ does what the Ant
<batchtest> task does.
